p: IFA test shows high sensitivity (97%) but low specificity (70%) in comparison to an ELISA test [ 26]. Consequently, IFA positive serum samples were further investigated using a serum neutralization test (SNT) with high specificity [ 52], an accepted gold standard for the diagnosis of CDV-antibodies as described by [ 34], thereby avoiding the possible cross-reaction between CDV antibodies and other morbilliviruses.
